vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
στάδιος [ᾰ], α, ον,
(ἵστημι) standing fast and firm, σ. ὑσμίνη close fight, fought hand to hand, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; ἐνὶ σταδίῃ (i.e. ὑσμίνῃ) [Refs 8th c.BC+], compare σταδαῖο; [πῖδαξ] σταδίη μένει, of a spring from which no water flows, [Refs 3rd c.AD+]
__2 firm, fixed, θάλαμοι [Refs 5th c.BC+]. immobility, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__3 standing upright or straight, σ. χιτών,= ὀρθοστάδιον, an ungirt tunic hanging in straight plaits, [Refs 3rd c.BC+], compare στατό; θώραξ σ. a stiff breastplate, plate-armour, opposed to στρεπτός or ἁλυσιδωτός, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
__II (ἵστημι A.IV) weighed, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: arena, stadium, race course; a unit of length: stade (about 200 yards) stadia
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
arena, stadium, race course; a unit of length: stade (about 200 yards) stadia
primarily a fixed standard of measure; a stadium, the eighth part of a Roman mile, and nearly equal to a furlong, containing 201.45 yards, about 192 meters, Lk. 24:13; Mt. 14:24; Jn. 6:19; 11:18; Rev. 14:20; 21:16; a race-course, a race, 1Cor. 9:24*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: estadio (medida griega de alrededor de 192 metros)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 長度單位, 約 600 呎 (185 公尺)
2) 運動場 (林前 9:24)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 长度单位, 约 600 呎 (185 公尺)
2) 运动场 (林前 9:24)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: (a) một sân vận động, một phần tám dặm La Mã (dặm185 m), (b) một trường đua cho các trò chơi công cộng.
